Title: Application of Spectroscopic Techniques to Interrogate Skin
Source: Nov. Deliv. Syst. for Transdermal and Intradermal Drug Deliv.
Abstract: © 2015 John Wiley & Sons, Ltd.It is surprising that in the twenty-first century, it is still difficult to treat skin diseases effectively and this has a huge impact on the quality of life of a large number of people. Considerable developments in the instrumentation and data analysis associated with the major spectroscopic methods have taken place in recent years. A range of spectroscopic techniques have been used to interrogate and understand the skin barrier. This chapter discusses the various spectroscopic methods which have been investigated over the years. These include the electronic spectroscopic methods (UV spectroscopy and nuclear magnetic resonance), vibrational spectroscopic methods and other miscellaneous methods, including opto-thermal transient emission radiometry, electron spin resonance, impedance spectroscopy, laser-induced breakdown spectroscopy, and mass spectrometry imaging.
